intro: Vivaria, commonly known as the vivarium plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. These plants are native to tropical regions and are characterized by their striking, often colorful inflorescences. They typically have broad, waxy leaves that are adapted to thrive in humid environments. Vivaria species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique foliage and showy flowers. They require well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
